questions.question: How do I collect an article?
questions.answer: Go to any article in the Wikipedia (or Wikiwand) website. You'll find a <md-icon md-image="icon: bookmark-outline"></md-icon> button in the right bottom corner of the page, click it to collect it

questions.question: How can I save an article to read it offline?
questions.answer: Open the article from the extension and click on the <md-icon md-image="icon: pin"></md-icon> button at the right side of the toolbar. Click again to remove.

questions.question: What is the difference between collecting and saving an article?
questions.answer:
A collected article is just a reference and does not have the content. When you save it offline, the content is stored on your computer to open it without internet connection.
An article can be offline and not collected, collected and not offline, or both things. You can see your offline articles on the "Offline" option in the menu.

questions.question: How do I remove an article from a list?
questions.answer: In the article list, put the cursor over the article and click the <md-icon md-image="icon: bookmark-remove"></md-icon> button.

questions.question: How can I open an article in the web interface instead of the reader?
questions.answer: In the article list or in the reader, click the <md-icon md-image="icon: launch"></md-icon> button.
